summary:
As a dedicated Programme Management specialist with a focus on Gender Equality and the empowerment of women, I bring a wealth of experience from working with International Organizations and Civil Society Organizations across Africa and Europe. Through these experiences, I have honed my expertise in various areas, including coordination, planning, research, grant writing, and proposal development.

My passion for the field extends to a deep interest in International Law, particularly in the domains of International Criminal Justice discourse, Humanitarian Law, and Human Rights Law. I firmly believe in the transformative power of a Rights-Based approach to Project Management assignments, and I am committed to contributing my skills and knowledge to projects that uphold the principles of justice, equality, and human rights.

Throughout my career, I have actively pursued opportunities to engage with diverse teams, working collaboratively to achieve shared goals and positive outcomes. My ability to effectively navigate and coordinate complex projects has allowed me to foster impactful partnerships with stakeholders from diverse backgrounds.

Moreover, I am keen on leveraging my experiences to create inclusive and sustainable initiatives that advance Gender Equality and Women's Empowerment. My dedication to these causes is deeply rooted in my belief in the potential of empowering women and marginalized communities to drive social change and foster resilient societies.

As I embark on the next phase of my professional journey, I am eager to explore new challenges and broaden my horizons in Programme Management. With a commitment to continuous learning and growth, I am excited to contribute my skills and expertise to projects that align with my core values and align with the principles of Rule of Law and Human Rights.

I embrace the call to venture beyond the confines of the capital and endeavour to explore the diverse world around us. I seek to understand the intricacies of human existence, what drives people, and what lies at the heart of their experiences. Above all, i want to uphold the profound dignity of those whose lives are intertwined with the work we do. I look forward to the prospect of collaborating with like-minded individuals and organizations to effect positive change and contribute to a more just and equitable world.

profile_positions.description:
As a Situation Desk Associate in the Coordination and Planning Unit, I am dedicated to optimizing mission planning and strategic operations for Field Offices. I ensure seamless coordination, logistics, and administrative support to achieve efficient field operations.

I thrive in liaising with Field Offices and various headquarters stakeholders, effectively bridging communication gaps and fostering collaborative efforts. With a keen eye for detail, I excel in matching travelers' requirements with Field Office capacity, ensuring smooth and secure travel arrangements.

My commitment extends to enhancing preparedness and resilience through training, simulations, and lessons learned exercises in collaboration with key players. I am passionate about contributing to the success of critical operations and supporting teams in delivering impactful results.
profile_positions.title: Coordination and Planning

profile_positions.description:
I provided essential support to the Executive Director and Board Members of the Trust Fund for Victims. As the focal point for the Field Office, I offered administrative support to assist in fundraising, visibility, and organizational development activities. 

 I played a crucial role in organizing internal and external meetings, including annual Board Meetings and  annual Assembly of State Parties side events for the secretariat. I was responsible for providing logistical and administrative support for these events.

I conducted research and prepared supporting documentation for the secretariat, ensuring effective communication with The Registry's sections through administrative assistance.

Regarding travel, I assisted TFV programme staff  with logistical support, such as visa requests, security, and medical clearances, as well as creating mission plans. I also supported the Monitoring and Evaluation staff by conducting research and gathering necessary information. I supported the timely preparation of various reports, including the TFV Annual Progress Report, Annual Report to the Assembly of the States Parties, documents for External Auditors, and Donor Reports.

I  prepared documents and files for submission to the Registry's Procurement and Legal Sections for processing project contracts. Additionally, I prepared documentation for meetings with the Procurement Review Committee.

In the realm of finance, I assisted the Programme Office in preparing documentation for projects' payments and closure, and contributed to budget analysis and monitoring of programme expenditure while ensuring budget obligations, creating purchase requisitions, and processing project disbursements.

Furthermore, I was involved in communication and outreach efforts, helping prepare and format official project-related memoranda, summaries, and excel tables.

I managed the Trust Fund for Victims' website and Social Media sites, specifically Twitter.
profile_positions.title: Programme Administration (Trust Fund for Victims)

profile_positions.location: New York, New York, United States
profile_positions.description:
As the Co-Lead for the International Day of Remembrance of and Tribute to Victims of Terrorism, I spearheaded a multifaceted initiative, engaging victims, victims' associations, and civil society organizations to commemorate this solemn occasion alongside the United Nations Secretary General.

Key Responsibilities:

Developed and executed a comprehensive communications and visibility plan, successfully positioning the International Day through strategic messaging and impactful media content.
Orchestrated the logistical and substantive aspects of the International Day of Victims of Terrorism, fostering meaningful virtual geographical side events and facilitating strategic communications training for participants and victims.
Assumed the role of Communications focal point, driving the development and implementation of vital materials, including the powerful film 'Surviving Terrorism, The Power of Connections', SG statements, USG talking points, and press releases.
Designed and delivered the Victims Sensitization Course and Victims Engagement Strategy, equipping all staff members with essential skills to sensitively interact with victims of terrorism during their regular work activities.
As a seasoned professional in programme management, I take pride in my ability to provide substantive support and logistical expertise to drive impactful initiatives. My commitment to amplifying the voices of victims and fostering a compassionate approach underpins my dedication to this critical mission.

I also offered support to the Global Congress of Victims of Terrorism through desk research for the Panel Series. 

#ProgrammeManagement #VictimsOfTerrorism #EventManagement #CommunicationsExpert #HumanitarianEffor
profile_positions.title: Programme Officer - United Nations Office of Counter Terrorism, Victims of Terrorism Unit

profile_positions.description:
Being passionate about driving impactful initiatives that support education and cross-cultural communication, I joined the Pan African Masters Consortium for Interpretation and Translation (PAMCIT) as a Programme Management Associate. I was instrumental in facilitating the Consortium's mission and fostering collaboration among all the stakeholders.

I  worked closely with the Permanent Secretary to efficiently manage the merits-based system of scholarships for interpretation and translation students, ensuring equitable opportunities for aspiring scholars.

A key aspect of my responsibilities was managing student mobility for global internships, broadening horizons and enriching learning experiences. I took pride in assisting with programme monitoring and evaluation, ensuring transparency and continuous improvement in our initiatives.

As part of the dynamic team, I played a pivotal role in designing, launching, and managing the Consortium's website, establishing an accessible platform to showcase our mission and achievements.

Through my expertise in event organization, I successfully organised Training for Trainers seminars and Pan-African conferences on translation and interpretation, promoting knowledge sharing and professional development within the field.

Additionally, I was entrusted with convening annual meetings of the Executive Committee, fostering meaningful dialogues and driving collective decision-making processes.

In the realm of finance management, I diligently managed programme budgets and supported the preparation and review of funding requests. My keen eye for detail has allowed me to monitor expenditures, identify variances, and prepare accurate budget performance reports.

I take pride in my ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders and respond to inquiries on administrative and financial matters. My commitment to financial accountability extends to diligently monitoring accounts and payments to implementing partners.
profile_positions.title: Programme Management Associate (PAMCIT)
Individual Contractor - Victims and Witnesses Unit

profile_positions.description:
As a Project Management expert, I am deeply committed to advancing the field of International Criminal Justice through research, strategic planning, and effective communications. My diverse skill set and proactive approach have allowed me to make significant contributions to various projects and initiatives.

My passion for engaging youth in Africa led me to draft a virtual Africa youth engagement strategy, fostering meaningful connections and promoting dialogue within the community. Additionally, I played a key role in resource mobilization by editing a project proposal for the European Union Grant application, ensuring financial support for critical endeavors. My strategic planning expertise came to the forefront as I prepared the organization's five-year budget (2016 to 2020), ensuring financial stability and effective allocation of resources for long-term growth.

In the realm of communications, I have honed my research and editing abilities to produce high-quality articles on International Criminal Justice. My role involved transcribing interview materials for publications in the annual report and drafting compelling news articles for online communication platforms, such as the AFLA website, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter.

As an efficient administrator, I managed daily office activities, including phone inquiries, file maintenance (both virtual and hardcopy), and finance and logistical support. I took pride in developing and updating the office manual and implementing streamlined procedures through an administrative database management system, ensuring seamless operations.

Furthermore, I demonstrated my events management skills by successfully organizing AFLA's capacity building initiatives and arranging three side events for the Fifteenth Session of the International Criminal Court Assembly of State Parties.
profile_positions.title: Project Associate

profile_positions.description:
With a strong focus on Women's Economic Empowerment, I contributed to impactful initiatives that advance gender equality on a global scale through policy dialogue, programmatic activities, and country support across 22 African countries.

I provided substantive advisory and program development support to the Regional Office, by ensuring effective implementation of Women's Economic Empowerment programming in agribusiness, climate smart agriculture, energy, financial inclusion, and entrepreneurship development. I draft ed reports, briefing papers, concept notes, project proposals, talking points and speeches on UN Women's work in these fields. 

I had the opportunity to organize the Empowerment Conversation series. These discussions aimed to share timely knowledge on gender-related issues, engage colleagues, and stimulate debates to accelerate gender integration in development discourses. The series covered topics such as the cost of the gender gap in agricultural productivity, climate-resilient gender-sensitive policy making and programming, technology upscaling, alternative macro-economic frameworks, inclusive financing, and gender and resilience.

I supported the Mid-Term review process for the 2014/2017 strategic note and the Annual Work Plan review process for the Regional and Country Offices. My engagement in the quarterly program planning, monitoring, evaluation, and results-based reporting contributed to the successful implementation of programs and initiatives.

I was entrusted with building and maintaining strong partnerships with regional bodies and other stakeholders, through the Women's Empowerment Principles (WEPs) platform. I effectively established and sustained public-private partnerships, empowering women in the workplace, marketplace, and community.

My dedication to resource mobilization was evident in my contributions to the Extractive Industries project proposal, demonstrating my commitment to securing funding to support important initiatives.
profile_positions.title: Programme Associate- Women's Economic Empowerment (Consultant)

profile_positions.description:
During the 2015 Sharefair on Gender Equality in the Extractive Industries I was instrumental in creating a collaborative and well-organized event that promoted gender equality and fostered meaningful partnerships.
My responsibilities encompassed diverse aspects of logistical and administrative support, contributing to the seamless execution of the Sharefair. I facilitated partner meetings, ensured accurate documentation of discussions and decisions.

I provided valuable support to secure funding and resources for the Sharefair and provided assistance with donor reporting.

I organized, compiled, and processed relevant data, enabling efficient decision-making and reporting during and after the Sharefair.

Within the Sharefair Technical Planning Committee, I provided valuable assistance to the Individual Working Groups, fostering collaboration and coordination in achieving shared objectives.

Additionally, I served as the communication focal point for the Extractive Industries project, ensuring effective dissemination of information to stakeholders and the public.

I initiated a mapping study to document possible mentors and mentees for inclusion in the mentorship program and supported the development of a virtual engagement platform for the Extractive Industries communities of practice.

I played a significant role in the curriculum development program, which offers transformative leadership training on Gender and Mining Law to various stakeholders. 

My rapporteur duties during workshops and events contributed to detailed reports that furthered the dissemination of knowledge.

In collaboration with the African Union's Department of Trade and Industry (DTI), African Mines Development Centre (AMDC), and UNDP, I worked on a gender review of the Africa Mining Vision (AMV) and its Action Plan, advocating for meaningful inclusion of gender-equality measures, indicators, and action plans.
profile_positions.title: Programme Assistant-Knowldge Sharefair on Gender Equality in the Extractive Industries (Consultant)

profile_positions.description:
As a Programme Management Intern, I had the privilege of working in the Partners and Inter-Agency Coordination Branch (PIACB) of the External Relations Division. 
I actively supported the implementation of internal strategies for agency-wide partnership management and interagency coordination, which included the application of the Partnership Strategy and specific tasks aimed at enhancing UN-Habitat's relationships with other UN agencies.

One of my key responsibilities was conducting research to update information in agency partnership information management systems, spreadsheets, and other resources to align with PIACB's objectives.

I contributed to the editing of reports and briefs for meetings between UN-Habitat and various UN entities.

Another significant project I was involved in was the Strengthening Partnerships for an African Urban Agenda (AUA) project. This initiative focused on establishing and reinforcing partnerships between state and non-state actors to advance a new urban agenda in Africa. I supported the implementation of the project and empowering Habitat Agenda Partners to contribute with quality input in shaping the AUA.

One of the highlights of my experience was working closely with African government officials, particularly housing ministries. I assisted in preparing legal agreements and diligently followed up on the signing of MOUs. These agreements paved the way for the next phase of the project, which involved synthesizing the Urban reports and further advancing the African Urban Agenda.

My time at UN-Habitat allowed me to develop a deeper understanding of partnership management, interagency coordination, and the importance of effective communication in achieving shared goals. I am proud to have contributed to projects aimed at addressing urban challenges and promoting sustainable development in Africa.
profile_positions.title: Programme Management Trainee, Partners and Inter-Agency Coordination, External Relations Division

profile_positions.description:
During my enriching internship with The Africa Diaspora Policy Centre, I was involved in a significant project called the European wide Africa Diaspora Platform for Development (EADPD). This project, funded by the European Commission, aimed to study African migration trends in the European Union and shed light on the Migration and Development Nexus.

My role in the project involved conducting extensive desk research on Africa migration topics, which contributed to the successful completion of draft country profiles for the EADPD project. This experience equipped me with valuable knowledge and skills in the field of migration and development, particularly in understanding the significant impact of remittances in Africa, surpassing Official Development Assistance (ODA) and positively influencing poverty eradication.

As part of my responsibilities, I actively engaged in external and internal communications, ensuring that relevant information was regularly updated on the ADPC website and social media accounts, including Facebook and LinkedIn. This allowed me to contribute to the organization's social media and brand strategy, enhancing its visibility and outreach.

I also played a key role in searching for information, archiving data, and updating the migration database, which was crucial for ongoing strategy development and decision-making within the project.

Additionally, I actively participated in the preparations for workshops and project meetings, where I skillfully took minutes, ensuring comprehensive documentation of discussions and decisions.

Beyond the EADPD project, I also contributed to the office management, handling agenda management and planning appointments. Moreover, I took an active role in updating the office manual, implementing new office procedures, and contributing to the overall efficiency and organization of the workplace.
profile_positions.title: Programme Assistant and Office Management Intern

profile_positions.description:
At Zawadi Africa Education Fund, I had the privilege of being part of a scholarship foundation and leadership organization committed to nurturing Africa's next generation of women leaders. 

The main focus was on developing the leadership potential and capabilities of the female scholarship recipients while instilling a sense of giving back to their communities. We identified brilliant students from disadvantaged backgrounds who also demonstrated exceptional leadership potential. We encouraged these successful students to participate in U.S. and African leadership conferences, fostering active engagement in leadership roles during their university journey, and even inspiring some to initiate their own community projects.

We collaborated with the U.S. State Department in Washington, The Coca-Cola Africa Foundation in South Africa, Google in Switzerland, and The MasterCard Foundation in Canada. Together, we supported the program's initiatives and fostered meaningful partnerships to expand our impact and reach.

Furthermore, I played a vital role in organizing the Annual Africa Leadership Programme, an event that brought together our scholars to enhance their leadership skills through conferences and award ceremonies. It was inspiring to see them grow into empowered and confident leaders, ready to make a positive impact on their communities and beyond.

As part of the resource mobilization efforts, I actively contributed to the success of the Annual Fundraising Event, securing crucial funding for the organization's projects and initiatives. Additionally, I engaged in partnerships building with universities that generously provided scholarships, further expanding the reach of our mission.
profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator

Empowering Children for a Sustainable Future: Aflatoun International Meeting 2016
The overall theme of the International Meeting is Social and Financial Education Contributing to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
